en.C1N1: A long time ago, I lived in a village where my friend Rodrigo lived. We were great childhood friends.
en.C1N2: As time passed, I grew up and had to move away to complete my studies in paleontology.
en.C1N3: I hadn’t heard from my old village for years, except that, some time ago, a mine was opened.
en.C1N4: However, since the mine opened, there has been a large amount of, shall we say, strange discoveries.
en.C1N5: People have found skeletons of fantastical creatures. Cyclopes, monsters, and even dragons have appeared.
en.C1N6: The village where I grew up has become an important tourist spot. One day, I received a letter from Rodrigo.
en.C1N7: He congratulated me on my studies, but the most important thing was that he wanted to know what was really happening.
en.C1N8: My curiosity was piqued, so I decided to go.
en.C1R1: Hello! Long time no see, I hope you're not too tired from the journey.
en.C1R2: Look, I'll be direct, I need your help.
en.C1R3: People are going crazy, and some can’t sleep thinking there are monsters out there. I'm gonna show you what I'm talking about.
en.C1R4: This is what we’ve been able to find. I know you’ve studied this subject, so I trust you to explain what’s really going on, old friend. Please, help us
en.C1P1: The bones of fantastical creatures are often those of extinct animals. To prove this, I should compare these bones with existing animals.
en.C1R5: First, we have the skull of a cyclops.
en.C1P2: This seems to be a robust animal; I should compare it to strong animals.
en.C1P3: Of course! The hole that looks like an eye is actually its nasal cavity. It's a mammoth, a relative of elephants.
en.C1R6: Next, let me show you the unicorn.
en.C1P4: That’s definitely a horn. I should analyze animals with horns.
en.C1P6: They weren't entirely wrong. While it's not a horse, it’s a member of the rhinoceros family, specifically the Elasmotherium sibiricum, better known as the Siberian Unicorn.
en.C1R7: This is an old one; they say it’s some kind of predator, almost as if it came from another world.
en.C1P7: It's a curious skull. It seems to have sturdy fangs, but also front teeth.
en.C1P8: By the shape of the skull, I can see it looks like a feline—it's a saber-toothed cat.
en.C1R8: Thank you so much for helping me. I think this will be enough, but I have one last question.
en.C1R9: There are no elephants, tigers, or rhinos around here. Why are these skeletons here?
en.C1Q1: Why are animals like these in the village?
en.C1A2: They are extinct animals that lived here.
en.C1A3: Some trade may have brought these animals here in the past.
en.C1X1: So you must be the expert.
en.C1X2: I was looking for you. It’s said you’re good at explaining and figuring out the origins of our creatures.
en.C1X3: You know, ever since the mine started, we found a dragon skeleton. Dragons are very sacred in my family, so we’ve kept the remains in my house.
en.C1X4: Do you think you could take a look and verify if it’s authentic?
en.C2X1: Welcome, make yourself at home. I’ll show you our dragon soon. I’d greatly appreciate your opinion.
en.C2P1: This is a complete skeleton. I should analyze each part to give a concrete answer.
en.C2P2: I'll start with the most obvious part, the head.
en.C2P3: I understand why it looks like a dragon; it’s similar to…
en.C2P4: That’s correct, it’s similar to a lizard. But I don’t think it’s a dragon.
en.C2P5: Let’s take a look at the wings. The body seems to have a texture similar to…
en.C2P6: They look a lot like feathers.
en.C2P7: Feathers and a lizard head… there must be something to support a theory I have.
en.C2P9: They should belong to something with scales or claws...
en.C2P10: That’s right, they seem similar to those of birds.
en.C2P11: Miss Xiao, what you have here is none other than a dinosaur.
en.C2X2: A dinosaur? But how do you explain the wings and feathers? A bird doesn’t have a lizard’s head.
en.C2Q1: Miss Xiao has a point. How can I explain the lizard’s head and bird-like features?
en.C2A1: It was a mixture of both animals.
en.C2A3: Reptiles, dinosaurs, and birds share a common ancestor.
en.C2P12: Actually, we all come from the same form of life. It's through evolution that we experience small changes that, over millennia, make each of us so different.
en.C2X4: That would explain the scales on bird legs
en.C2R1: Hello, hello! I hope I’m not interrupting. Old Charlie is looking for you—he’s a famous miner. He wants to show you something you won’t regret.
en.C3C1: Hey, hello, nice to meet you. I’m Charlie, better known as the best miner in town.
en.C3C2: I’ve seen many animals, but none like this one.
en.C3C4: It seems to be a big monster.
en.C3P1: I see, it’s definitely a giant animal.
en.C3P2: Mr. Charlie, what you have here is a whale.
en.C3C5: A whale, you say? But whales don’t have legs!
en.C3P3: I need to convince Charlie that this is a whale.
en.C3P4: If I correctly order its evolutionary line, I can prove it’s a whale.
en.C3P5: As you can see, certain characteristics have been preserved, like the head, the ribs, or the way its legs resemble flippers.
en.C3C6: Let’s see if this is your size. I’ll show you my most treasured find. Wait a few minutes.
en.C4C1: Thank you for waiting. Now then.
en.C4C2: Ladies and gentlemen, the incredible Bigfoot!
en.C4P1: Let me take a closer look...
en.C4P2: If it’s Bigfoot, it does seem to be some kind of primate...
en.C4P3: I’ll compare it with other primates, starting with its head.
en.C4P4: It’s a similar head, but I need to analyze its ribs.
en.C4P5: Yes! I just want to do one last check on its feet.
en.C4P7: Charlie, what you have here, I’m afraid, is not Bigfoot.
en.C4P8: But that doesn’t make it any less significant—what you have here is an ancestor of humans.
en.C4C4: Forgive me, but we don’t bear much resemblance to this thing I have here.
en.C4P10: There you go, Mr. Charlie. I hope I’ve been helpful.
en.C4R1: Hey, hello! I hope I’m not late. It’s time for you to leave. There’s a surprise I want to give you. Come with me.
en.C4R2: It’s a party! We wanted to throw you a party before you leave and thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your patience
en.C4R3: We have renamed our museum “The Great Museum of Natural History”
en.C4R4: And again, thanks for your help, please enjoy the party!

jp.readyToPlay: あなたは遊ぶ準備ができていますか？
jp.pressContinue: 続行するには '次へ'ボタンを押してください。
